document.ModsDocTitle: Three new species of the spider genus Plato and the new genus Cuacuba from caves of the states of Pará and Minas Gerais, Brazil (Araneae, Theridiosomatidae)
document.docAuthor: Prete, Pedro H., Cizauskas, Igor & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.docTitle: Cuacuba morrodopilar Prete, Cizauskas & Brescovit, 2018, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of the spider genus Plato and the new genus Cuacuba from caves of the states of Para and Minas Gerais, Brazil (Araneae, Theridiosomatidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of the spider genus Plato and the new genus Cuacuba from caves of the states of Para and Minas Gerais, Brazil (Araneae, Theridiosomatidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Male holotype and female paratype from Cave MP_07 ( 19°15'30"S , 43°22'35"W ), Morro do Pilar, Minas Gerais, Brazil, 12-24/IX/2011, Equipe Carste coll., deposited in IBSP 174389; Paratypes: male and female (IBSP 174387); one female (MZSP 70928); one female (MPEG 32026), 13-17/II/2012, all with same of data of holotype.

Brazil, Minas Gerais: Morro do Pilar, Cave MP_06 ( 19°14'58"S , 43°21'09"W ), 3♀, 12-24/IX/2011 (IBSP 174383-174384); 3♀, 12-24/IX/2011, J. Mascarenhas coll. (IBSP 174385, IBSP 174394); 1♂ 3♀, 13-17/II/2012 (IBSP 174395, IBSP 174400); Cave MP_07 ( 19°15'30"S , 43°22'35"W ), 2♂ 8♀, 12-24/IX/2011 Equipe Carste coll. (IBSP 174387-IBSP174392); 15♀, 13-17/II/2012, (IBSP 174396-174399) all collected by Equipe Carste; 1♂ 7♀, 12-24/IX/2011, J. Mascarenhas coll. (IBSP 174386- IBSP 174389, IBSP 174393).
The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality.

Male of C. morrodopilar sp. n. differs from C. mariana sp. n. by the anterior conductor apophysis with flattened tip (Fig. 14 D-E ) and by the median apophysis with protruding and recurve tip, darkened (Fig. 14D, F, H). Females can be distinguished by the posterior margin of epigynal plate in "U" shape, with very remarkable distally notched transversal groove (Fig. 15 A-E ).

caption.paragraph: Figure 14. Cuacuba morrodopilar sp. n. A male, dorsal view B female, dorsal view C male palp, ventral view D male palp, ventral view (SEM) E detail of the lower conductor apophysis tip (SEM) F, G, H male palp, expanded (F, ventral view G dorsal view, H, retrolateral view). Abbreviations: ACA anterior conductor apophysis; C conductor; CA conductor apophysis; E embolus; EA embolic apophysis; MA median apophysis; O embolic opening; PCA posterior conductor apophysis; ST subtegulum; T tegulum. Scale bars: A 0.9; B 1.1; C, F-H 0.2; D 0.1; E 0.04 mm.

Figure 15. Cuacuba morrodopilar sp. n. A female epigynum, ventral view B female epigynum, dorsal view, clarified (LM) C female epigynum, ventral view (SEM) D female epigynum, ventral view with plate removed (SEM) E female epigynum, dorsal (drawing). Abbreviations: CD copulatory ducts; CO copulatory opening; TG transversal groove; FD fertilization ducts; S spermathecae. Scale bars: A, 0.9; B 0.13; C, D 0.1; E 0.25 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female (paratype IBSP 174389). Coloration as in male. Total length: 1.8. Carapace: 0.9 long. Clypeus 0.18 high. Sternum 0.51 long, 0.48 wide. Eye measurements: AME: 0.07; ALE-PLE: grouped, 0.06 each; PME-PME: separated by 1 PME (0.07 each). Legs: I femur 1.07/ patella 0.45/ tibia 0.75/ metatarsus 0.61/ tarsus 0.48/ total 3.36 . II 0.92/ 0.46/ 0.61/ 0.45/ 0.44/ 2.88. III 0.58/ 0.3/ 0.42/ 0.37/ 0.36/ 2.03. IV 0.76/ 0.3/ 0.54/ 0.44/ 0.35/ 2.39. Epigynal plate larger than long, with long bristles (Fig. 14 A-D ). Spermathecae connate (Fig. 15B, D-E ). Abdomen: 1.24 long.
2 males: total length: 1.3-1.7; carapace: 0.75-0.91; femur 1: 0.77-0.9; 10 females: total length: 1.78-2.8; carapace: 0.75-1.05; femur I: 1-1.25.
Known only from the type locality, Morro do Pilar, Minas Gerais, Brazil (Fig. 17).

caption.paragraph: Figure 16. Distribution maps of Plato ferriferus sp. n. (diamond), P. striatus sp. n. (triangle) and P. novalima sp. n. (square) in states of Para and Minas Gerais, Brazil.
Figure 17. Distribution maps of Cuacuba mariana sp. n. (circle) and C. morrodopilar sp. n. (star) in state of Minas Gerais, Brazil.
